title: CV
text:
Skills
I work extensively with Julia, Python, and R across various projects, each tailored to specific use cases. My primary focus for data collection, web crawling, and scraping is Python, with some use of JavaScript for front-end automation. I prioritize reproducibility and containerization, utilizing Docker to ensure consistent environments across projects. Most of my documentation and writing is done in Quarto, which I also use to build websites, including this one.

title: Working Projects
text:
Here you’ll find a variety of projects I’m currently working on. While not all are strictly academic, they reflect my personal interests and passions that I pursue in my free time.
 






How politcal




A prediction model that leverages real-time video data and advanced web scraping techniques to determine the political stance of a video using machine learning approaches. The model analyzes the content across a multi-axis spectrum to provide a nuanced classification of the video’s political orientation.










HOWPopular — soon to be published




A dashboard providing an overview of the popularity of German Bundestag members. It integrates data from Wikipedia, social media metrics, and other public sources to offer a comprehensive analysis of their public presence and influence

title: Paul Elvis Otto
text:
Hello! I’m Paul Elvis Otto, a dual degree master’s student in Data Science at the Hertie School in Berlin and Public Policy at Duke University. Alongside my studies, I work as a Research Assistant in Social Data Science at the University of Marburg. I am passionate about leveraging data-driven insights to understand and address complex social and political phenomena. Through my work, I aim to bridge the gap between technology and society, contributing to meaningful change and use data for good.
To find out more about my work you can check out my Working Projects or take a look at my CV
